thread.title: WATCH: Sinking cars and street surfers as floods hit SA
thread.title_full: WATCH: Sinking cars and street surfers as floods hit SA

title: WATCH: Sinking cars and street surfers as floods hit SA
text:
Print Heavy rainfall and flooding has been reported across much of South Africa this week. 
A large tropical trough is letting moisture-laden air flow across SA’s interior from the north. Roads have become obstructed as they disappear under fast-flowing water. 
Cars have fallen prey to the floods. 
Flood warnings remain in place as widespread showers are expected across much of the country. 
Gauteng Weather has issued the following reminder; 20cm of water can sweep a car off the road; half a metre can float a car; and you should never drive around barricades. Precaution: Never drive into water covering the road as you may not know how deep it is or if the road has been washed away. — SA Weather Service (@SAWeatherServic) February 21, 2017 Share Tweet SHARE YOUR OPINION If you have an opinion you would like to share on this article, please to the Times LIVE iLIVE team. In the mean time, click here to view the Times LIVE iLIVE section.
